SENT.plain: Lethal achondrogenesis in the past has been frequently confused with achondroplasia
Clinical and radiologic advances in the last decade have led to clear differentiation of this condition from other types of bone dysplasia
It is further separated into two types on the basis of radiographic and pathologic findings
Re-evaluation of the histologic features has led to the recognition of heretofore unrecognized intracytoplasmic inclusion bodies in the chondrocytes of type 1 achondrogenesis
The finding of inclusions strengthens the differentiation of the two types and may have implications for the pathogenesis of the form of chondrodystrophy
